meanings.definition: A unit of measurement equal to one trillionth of a mole.
meanings.sent1: She measured the substance in picomoles to determine its concentration.
meanings.sent2: The scientist calculated the number of picomoles in the sample.
meanings.sent3: The tiny creature only needed a picomole of food to feel full.
meanings.sent4: The picomoles of data in the experiment were too small to analyze accurately.
meanings.sent5: The picomoles of sugar in the solution were barely detectable.

meanings.definition: The amount of a substance that contains 6.022 x 10^11 molecules.
meanings.sent1: The vial contained exactly one picomole of the compound.
meanings.sent2: The researchers needed to measure the picomoles of the chemical for the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The chef added a picomole of spice to the recipe for an extra kick.
meanings.sent4: The picomoles of perfume in the air created a pleasant aroma.
meanings.sent5: Detecting picomoles of contaminants in the water required advanced equipment.
